member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.LicenseManager
member.summary: Class for license management. Provides properties and methods to add one or multiple licenses to the Docotic.Pdf library.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.LicenseManager.Uid
member.summary: Retrieves an unique ID for your server. We generate server license keys using this UID.
member.value: Unique ID for this server.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.LicenseManager.HasValidLicense
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance has valid license(s).
member.value: true if this instance has valid license(s); otherwise, false.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.LicenseManager.AddLicenseData(System.String)
member.summary: Adds license data to the Docotic.Pdf library.
member.param: License key

remarks.para: You can use this method multiple times if you have several licenses which you use in one code base (usually, it's the case for a server application running on multiple servers).
We recommend to add all license data at the start of your application. It is not recommended to call this method each time before you create a instance.
In classic ASP.NET apps we recommended to add license data in Global.asax.cs. In ASP.NET Core apps we recommend to use Startup.cs for the same.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.LicenseManager.AddLicenseData(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds license data to the Docotic.Pdf library.
member.param: License key
The license owner.

remarks.para: We recommend to add all license data at the start of your application. It is not recommended to call this method each time before you create a instance.
In classic ASP.NET apps we recommended to add license data in Global.asax.cs. In ASP.NET Core apps we recommend to use Startup.cs for the same.

member.summary: Class for a JavaScript action. A JavaScript action causes a script to be compiled and executed by the JavaScript interpreter. Depending on the nature of the script, various interactive form fields in the document may update their values or change their visual appearances. Netscape Communications Corporation's "Client-Side JavaScript Reference" and the Adobe "JavaScript for Acrobat API Reference" give details on the contents and effects of JavaScript scripts.

member.summary: Represents a L*a*b* color space.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfLabColorSpace.#ctor(BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDocument,System.Double[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.overloads: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The document to which this color space belongs.
An array of three numbers [Xw Yw Zw] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse white point.

remarks.para: The numbers Xw and Zw must be positive, and Yw must be equal to 1.0.
Black point array is assumed to be [0.0 0.0 0.0].
Range is assumed to be [в€’100 100 в€’100 100].

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfLabColorSpace.#ctor(BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDocument,System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The document to which this color space belongs.
An array of three numbers [Xw Yw Zw] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse white point.
An array of three numbers [Xb Yb Zb] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse black point. Can be null.

remarks.para: The numbers Xw and Zw must be positive, and Yw must be equal to 1.0.
All three numbers in the array must be non-negative. If array is null then the black point array is assumed to be [0.0 0.0 0.0].

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfLabColorSpace.#ctor(BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDocument,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The document to which this color space belongs.
An array of three numbers [Xw Yw Zw] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse white point.
An array of three numbers [Xb Yb Zb] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse black point. Can be null.
An array of four numbers [amin amax bmin bmax] specifying the range of valid values for the a* and b* (B and C) components of the color space. Can be null.

remarks.para: The numbers Xw and Zw must be positive, and Yw must be equal to 1.0.
All three numbers in the array must be non-negative. If array is null then the black point array is assumed to be [0.0 0.0 0.0].
If array is null then the range array is assumed to be [в€’100 100 в€’100 100].

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSpotColor
member.summary: Represents a spot color.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The amount (concentration) of spot colorant (tint).
The separation color space in which the colorant is defined.

remarks.para: The value 0.0 for the parameter represents the minimum amount of colorant that can be applied; 1.0 represents the maximum. Thus, 0.0 denotes the lightest color that can be achieved with the given colorant, and 1.0 denotes the darkest.

member.remarks: This collection contains one element if the underlying color space is a or more, if the underlying color space is a .

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode
member.summary: Specifies names of standard blend modes available in PDF.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.Normal
member.summary: Selects the source color, ignoring the backdrop.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the backdrop and source color values. The result color is always at least as dark as either of the two constituent colors. Multiplying any color with black produces black; multiplying with white leaves the original color unchanged. Painting successive overlapping objects with a color other than black or white produces progressively darker colors.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result. The result color is always at least as light as either of the two constituent colors. Screening any color with white produces white; screening with black leaves the original color unchanged. The effect is similar to projecting multiple photographic slides simultaneously onto a single screen.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value. Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows. The backdrop color is not replaced but is mixed with the source color to reflect the lightness or darkness of the backdrop.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.Darken
F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors. The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is lighter; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with black produces no changes.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with white produces no change.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.Difference
F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to that of the mode but lower in contrast. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.Saturation
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color. Painting with this mode in an area of the backdrop that is a pure gray (no saturation) produces no change.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.Color
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color. This preserves the gray levels of the backdrop and is useful for coloring monochrome images or tinting color images.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBlendMode.Luminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color. This produces an inverse effect to that of the mode.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfFillMode
member.summary: Specifies how the interior of a closed path is filled.

remarks.para: For a simple path, it is intuitively clear what region lies inside. However, for a more complex path - for example, a path that intersects itself or has one subpath that encloses another - it is not always obvious which points lie inside the path. The path machinery uses one of two rules for determining which points lie inside a path: the nonzero winding number rule and the even-odd rule.

The even-odd rule determines whether a point is inside a path by drawing a ray from that point in any direction and simply counting the number of path segments that cross the ray, regardless of direction. If this number is odd, the point is inside; if even, the point is outside. This yields the same results as the nonzero winding number rule for paths with simple shapes, but produces different results for more complex shapes.

The image below shows the effects of applying the even-odd rule to complex paths. For the five-pointed star, the rule considers the triangular points to be inside the path, but not the pentagon in the center. For the two concentric circles, only the doughnut shape between the two circles is considered inside, regardless of the directions in which the circles are drawn.

The nonzero winding number rule determines whether a given point is inside a path by conceptually drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the path crosses the ray. Starting with a count of 0, the rule adds 1 each time a path segment crosses the ray from left to right and subtracts 1 each time a segment crosses from right to left. After counting all the crossings, if the result is 0, the point is outside the path; otherwise, it is inside.

Note: The method just described does not specify what to do if a path segment coincides with or is tangent to the chosen ray. Since the direction of the ray is arbitrary, the rule simply chooses a ray that does not encounter such problem intersections.

For simple convex paths, the nonzero winding number rule defines the inside and outside as one would intuitively expect. The more interesting cases are those involving complex or self-intersecting paths like the ones shown below:

For a path consisting of a five-pointed star, drawn with five connected straight line segments intersecting each other, the rule considers the inside to be the entire area enclosed by the star, including the pentagon in the center.
For a path composed of two concentric circles, the areas enclosed by both circles are considered to be inside, provided that both are drawn in the same direction.
If the circles are drawn in opposite directions, only the doughnut shape between them is inside, according to the rule; the doughnut hole is outside.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfFillMode.Alternate
member.summary: The alternate fill mode (the even-odd rule) should be used.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfFillMode.Winding
member.summary: The winding fill mode (the nonzero winding number rule) should be used.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfLineCap
member.summary: Specifies the shape to be used at the ends of open subpaths (and dashes, if any) when they are stroked.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfLineCap.ButtEnd
member.summary: The stroke is squared off at the endpoint of the path. There is no projection beyond the end of the path.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfLineCap.Round
member.summary: A semicircular arc with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the endpoint and filled in.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfLineCap.ProjectingSquare
member.summary: The stroke continues beyond the endpoint of the path for a distance equal to half the line width and is squared off.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfLineJoin
member.summary: Specifies the shape of joints between connected segments of a stroked path.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfLineJoin.Miter
member.summary: The outer edges of the strokes for the two segments are extended until they meet at an angle. If the segments meet at too sharp an angle (as defined by the property), a join is used instead.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfLineJoin.Round
member.summary: An arc of a circle with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the point where the two segments meet, connecting the outer edges of the strokes for the two segments. This pie slice-shaped figure is filled in, producing a rounded corner.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfLineJoin.Bevel
member.summary: The two segments are finished with butt caps (see property) and the resulting notch beyond the ends of the segments is filled with a triangle.

member.summary: Specifies the type of a .

member.summary: Rectangular segment. See class.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPathSegmentType.Point
member.summary: Point segment. See class.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPathSegmentType.Line
member.summary: Straight line segment. See class.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPathSegmentType.Bezier
member.summary: Bezier curve segment. See class.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPathSegmentType.CloseSubpath
member.summary: A segment, closing subpath. See class.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPatternPaintType
member.summary: Specifies how the color of the cell is to be specified.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPatternPaintType.Colored
member.summary: The pattern is colored. The pattern itself is to be used for drawing.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPatternPaintType.Uncolored
member.summary: The pattern has no color. The pattern describes a stencil through which the current color is to be poured.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPatternTiling
member.summary: Specifies adjustments to the spacing of tiles relative to the device pixel grid.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPatternTiling.ConstantSpacing
member.summary: Pattern cells are spaced consistently - that is, by a multiple of a device pixel. To achieve this, the application may need to distort the pattern cell slightly. The amount of distortion does not exceed 1 device pixel.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPatternTiling.NoDistortion
member.summary: The pattern cell is not distorted, but the spacing between pattern cells may vary by as much as 1 device pixel, both horizontally and vertically, when the pattern is painted.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPatternTiling.ConstantSpacingAndFasterTiling
member.summary: Pattern cells are spaced consistently as in but with additional distortion permitted to enable a more efficient implementation.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPermissionFlags
member.summary: Specifies user access permissions for an encrypted document.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPermissionFlags.None
member.summary: Permit only viewing.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPermissionFlags.PrintDocument
member.summary: Print the document.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPermissionFlags.ModifyContents
member.summary: Modify the contents of the document.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPermissionFlags.CopyContents
member.summary: Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPermissionFlags.ModifyAnnotations
member.summary: Add or modify text annotations, fill in interactive form fields.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPermissionFlags.FillFormFields
member.summary: Fill in existing interactive form fields (including signature fields).

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPermissionFlags.ExtractContents
member.summary: Extract text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes).

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPermissionFlags.AssembleDocument
member.summary: Assemble the document (insert, rotate, or delete pages and create bookmarks or thumbnail images).

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPermissionFlags.PrintFaithfulCopy
member.summary: Print the document to a representation from which a faithful digital copy of the PDF content could be generated.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPermissionFlags.Everything
member.summary: Permit everything.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfRenditionOperation
member.summary: Enumeration for all known rendition operations.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfRenditionOperation.Unspecified
member.summary: Operation is not specified.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfRenditionOperation.PlayNew
member.summary: If no rendition is associated with the annotation, play the specified rendition, associating it with the annotation. If a rendition is already associated with the annotation, it shall be stopped, and the new rendition shall be associated with the annotation.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfRenditionOperation.Stop
member.summary: Stop any rendition being played in association with the annotation, and remove the association. If no rendition is being played, there is no effect.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfRenditionOperation.Pause
member.summary: Pause any rendition being played in association with the annotation. If no rendition is being played, there is no effect.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfRenditionOperation.Resume
member.summary: Resume any rendition being played in association with the annotation. If no rendition is being played or the rendition is not paused, there is no effect.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfRenditionOperation.Play
T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfRotation
member.summary: Specifies the rotation of a .

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfRotation.None
member.summary: Page is not rotated.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfRotation.Rotate90
member.summary: Page is rotated 90 degrees clockwise.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfRotation.Rotate180
member.summary: Page is rotated 180 degrees clockwise.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfRotation.Rotate270
member.summary: Page is rotated 270 degrees clockwise.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureFieldLockAction
member.summary: All possible actions for a signature field lock.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureFieldLockAction.All
member.summary: All fields in the document get locked.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureFieldLockAction.Include
member.summary: All fields with the specified names get locked.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureFieldLockAction.Exclude
member.summary: All fields except fields with the specified names get locked.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureFormat
member.summary: Specifies digital signature formats.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureFormat.Pkcs7Detached
member.summary: The adbe.pkcs7.detached signature format.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureFormat.CadesDetached
member.summary: (PDF 1.7) The ETSI.CAdES.detached signature format.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureTextAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of the text in a digital signature.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureTextAlignment.Left
member.summary: Text is left justified.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureTextAlignment.Right
member.summary: Text is right justified.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureType
member.summary: Specifies digital signature type.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureType.Approval
member.summary: The approval signature type.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureType.AuthorNoChanges
member.summary: An author (certification) signature type. No changes allowed to the signed document.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureType.AuthorFormFillingAllowed
member.summary: An author (certification) signature type. It is allowed to fill the form in the signed document.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureType.AuthorFormFillingAndAnnotationsAllowed
member.summary: An author (certification) signature type. It is allowed to add annotations to and fill the form in the signed document.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSubmitFormat
member.summary: Specifies the form in which control names and values are submitted by .

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSubmitFormat.Html
member.summary: Control names and values are submitted in HTML Form format.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSubmitFormat.Fdf
member.summary: Control names and values are submitted in Forms Data Format (FDF).

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSubmitFormat.Xfdf
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) Control names and values are submitted in XML Forms Data Format (XFDF).

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSubmitFormat.Pdf
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) The whole document (not only control names and values) is submitted as PDF, using the MIME content type application/pdf (described in Internet RFC 2045, Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME), Part One: Format of Internet Message Bodies).

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfWidgetFlags
member.summary: Specifies various characteristics of a .

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfWidgetFlags.Invisible
member.summary: If set, do not display the widget if it does not belong to one of the standard widget types and there is no action associated with the widget.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfWidgetFlags.Hidden
member.summary: If set, do not display or print the widget or allow it to interact with the user, regardless of its widget type or whether there is an action associated with the widget.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfWidgetFlags.Print
member.summary: If set, print the widget when the page is printed. If clear, never print the widget, regardless of whether it is displayed on the screen.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfWidgetFlags.NoZoom
member.summary: If set, do not scale the widget's appearance to match the magnification of the page.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfWidgetFlags.NoRotate
member.summary: If set, do not rotate the widget's appearance to match the rotation of the page.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfWidgetFlags.NoView
member.summary: If set, do not display the widget on the screen or allow it to interact with the user. The widget may be printed (depending on the setting of the flag) but should be considered hidden for purposes of on-screen display and user interaction.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfWidgetFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: If set, do not allow the widget to interact with the user. The widget may be displayed or printed (depending on the settings of the and flags) but should not respond to mouse clicks or change its appearance in response to mouse motions.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfWidgetFlags.Locked
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, do not allow the widget to be deleted or its properties (including position and size) to be modified by the user. This flag does not restrict changes to the widget's contents, such as the value of a form field.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfWidgetFlags.ToggleNoView
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) If set, invert the interpretation of the flag for certain events.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfWidgetFlags.LockedContents
member.summary: (PDF 1.7) If set, do not allow the contents of the widget to be modified by the user. This flag does not restrict deletion of the widget or changes to other widget properties, such as position and size.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfZoom
member.summary: Specifies zoom type.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfZoom.PercentBased
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the coordinates (left, top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfZoom.FitPage
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfZoom.FitWidth
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfZoom.FitHeight
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfZoom.FitRect
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the rectangle specified by the coordinates left, bottom, right, and top entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfZoom.FitBBox
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfZoom.FitBBoxWidth
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfZoom.FitBBoxHeight
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.XmpArrayType

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.XmpArrayType.Unordered
member.summary: An unordered array. A list of values whose order does not have significance.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.XmpArrayType.Ordered
member.summary: An ordered array. A list whose order is significant.

member.name: F:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.XmpArrayType.Alternative
member.summary: An alternative array. A set of one or more values, one of which should be chosen.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfExponentialFunction
member.summary: Defines an exponential interpolation of one input value and n output values: f(x) = y0, ..., yn-1.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfExponentialFunction.#ctor(BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDocument,System.Double,System.Double[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.overloads: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The document to which this function belongs.
The interpolation exponent.
The domain of the function (the set of input values for which the function is defined).

remarks.para: Each input value x will return n values, given by yj = C0j + xN * (C1j в€’ C0j), for 0 в‰¤ j < n. Where N is the interpolation exponent specified by parameter.
C0 and C1 are assumed to have default values of [ 0.0 ] and [ 1.0 ] respectively.
Since the range of the function is not set, output values won't be clipped.

remarks.para: Each input value x will return n values, given by yj = C0j + xN * (C1j в€’ C0j), for 0 в‰¤ j < n. Where N is the interpolation exponent specified by parameter.
Since the range of the function is not set, output values won't be clipped.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfExponentialFunction.#ctor(BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDocument,System.Double,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[])

remarks.para: Each input value x will return n values, given by yj = C0j + xN * (C1j в€’ C0j), for 0 в‰¤ j < n. Where N is the interpolation exponent specified by parameter.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.ImageCompressionOptions.BitsPerPixel
member.summary: Get the number of bits per pixel of the image.
member.value: The number of bits per pixel of the image.

remarks.para: The lower the value, the less bytes will be used by the image.
Valid values for this property depend on the .

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.ImageCompressionOptions.TileWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of the tile to use while drawing.
member.value: The width of the tile to use while drawing.

remarks.para: This value is useful when you want to reduce amount of memory used while drawing.
The lower the value, the less memory is used but the overall drawing process will take more time.
The value of this property is ignored when output format is not TIFF.
The library uses the value of this property as a recommendation only and can use slightly bigger or smaller tiles if needed.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.ImageCompressionOptions.TileHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of the tile to use while drawing.
member.value: The height of the tile to use while drawing.

remarks.para: This value is useful when you want to reduce amount of memory used while drawing.
The lower the value, the less memory is used but the overall drawing process will take more time.
The value of this property is ignored when output format is not TIFF.
The library uses the value of this property as a recommendation only and can use slightly bigger or smaller tiles if needed.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.ImageCompressionOptions.BitonalConversionThreshold
member.summary: Gets the threshold level to use when producing bitonal images.
member.value: The threshold level to use when producing bitonal images.

remarks.para: The threshold level is used to decide which pixels are white and which are black when converting image data to black-and-white format.
The threshold level value should be between 0 and 255 inclusive. A threshold value 0 means that library should use midpoint between most light and dark pixels as a threshold value.

If the image contains some scanned document or other data with mostly white background pixels and mostly black foreground pixels then threshold level of 189 or higher is recommended to preserve most of the data.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.IPdfStreamProvider
member.summary: Exposes method used to acquire streams.

remarks.para: Streams are used by the library while creating, reading, or otherwise manipulating PDF documents. For example, streams are used to store decoded contents of document pages and as the intermediate storage for images.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.IPdfStreamProvider.GetStream(System.Int64)
member.summary: Gets a stream with initial capacity not less than specified.
member.param: Minimum initial capacity of the stream.
member.returns: Returns a stream with initial capacity not less than specified by the .

remarks.para: The stream must be readable, seekable and writable.
Caller of the method is responsible for disposing of the returned stream.
The library tries to specify size of the stream beforehand but it's possible for the library to request zero length streams and then increase streams length by writing to the stream.
Streams can be of almost any length from a few bytes to several megabytes.
Streams can be used for a short period of time or for the lifetime of the PDF document.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfConfigurationOptions
member.summary: The settings affecting the way works under the hood.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfConfigurationOptions.StreamProvider
member.summary: Gets the stream provider.
member.value: The stream provider.

remarks.para: The library uses streams while creating, reading, or otherwise manipulating PDF documents. For example, streams are used to store decoded contents of document pages and as the intermediate storage for images.
Number of streams used depends on the PDF document being processed and the way it's being processed.
Streams can be of almost any length from a few bytes to several megabytes.
The library tries to specify size of the stream beforehand but it's possible for the library to request zero length streams and then increase streams length by writing to the stream.
Streams can be used for a short period of time or for the lifetime of the PDF document.
The library disposes all streams acquired through the stream provider.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfConfigurationOptions.FontLoader
member.summary: Gets or sets the font loader.
member.value: The font loader to use.

remarks.para: The font loader can not be null. By default the library uses instances of for font loaders.

The library uses font loader to get font bytes when:
the font is not embedded in PDF document, or
the font is added to PDF document by using family name and style only

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfConfigurationOptions.Error
member.summary: Gets or sets the delegate to invoke when error event occurs.
member.value: The delegate to invoke when error event occurs.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfConfigurationOptions.XObjectCache
member.summary: Gets cache for form XObjects.
member.value: The cache for form XObjects.

remarks.para: This cache is disabled by default.

Enabling this cache can improve speed of processing for documents with a lot of form XObjects reused on different pages. Note that enabling the cache can either increase or decrease memory consumption based on the contents of the PDF.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfConfigurationOptions.Create
member.summary: Creates configuration options initialized with default stream provider.
member.returns: The newly created configuration options initialized with default stream provider.

remarks.para: By default the library uses instances of for document stream providers.
In cases when speed is most important and you are not concerned about memory footprint you might want to use instances of instead.
You are free to create and use any other stream provider.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfConfigurationOptions.CreateWithStreamProvider(BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.IPdfStreamProvider)
member.summary: Creates configuration options initialized with specified stream provider.
member.param: The stream provider to use in this options.
member.returns: The newly created configuration options initialized with specified stream provider.

remarks.para: By default the library uses instances of for document stream providers.
In cases when speed is most important and you are not concerned about memory footprint you might want to use instances of instead.
You are free to create and use any other stream provider.

member.summary: Creates default draw options.
member.returns: The newly created default draw options.

remarks.para:
Default draw options are:
Background is transparent.
Image format is .

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDrawOptions.CreateFitWidth(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates draw options for producing images of PDF pages resized to fit the specified width.
member.param: The width of images in pixels.
member.returns: The options for producing images of PDF pages resized to fit the specified width.

remarks.para: The width should be in the [1..10000] range.
Any image produced with these options will have the specified width. The height of the image will be calculated dynamically using aspect ratio of the PDF page being drawn.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDrawOptions.CreateFitSize(BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSize,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates draw options for producing images of PDF pages resized to fit the specified size.
member.param: The size of images in pixels.
Defines whether to cut unused space.
member.returns: The options for producing images of PDF pages resized to fit the specified size.

remarks.para: The width and height should be in the [1..10000] range.
If is true then images will have the same size as PDF pages resized to fit specified size.
If is false then images will have the size specified by , PDF pages will be drawn at the center of the image preserving aspect ratio and unused space will be filled with transparent color.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to remove all unused (unreferenced) objects from PDF before saving.
member.value: true if library should remove unused objects; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Setting this property to true helps to produce smaller output files.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSaveOptions.OptimizeIndirectObjects
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to optimize (inline) indirect objects from PDF before saving.
member.value: true if library should optimize indirect objects; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Setting this property to true helps to produce smaller output files.
Optimization means that all indirect PDF objects that are not dictionaries and arrays will be converted to direct objects.
Default value: true.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSaveOptions.WriteWithoutFormatting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to write PDF data without formatting (without whitespaces needed only for humans).
member.value: true if library should write PDF data without formatting; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Setting this property to true will cause library to use very minimum of whitespace characters when saving PDF files. It helps to produce smaller output files but may be not very convenient if you want to debug library output. Setting this property to false will cause library to write content of PDF file in human-readable form.
Default value: true.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSaveOptions.UseObjectStreams
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) Gets or sets a value indicating whether to pack objects into compressed object streams before producing PDF files.
member.value: true if library should use object streams; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Setting this property to true will cause library to pack objects into compressed object streams. This helps to produce smaller output files but will require Acrobat 6 / Adobe Reader 6 or later to view produced PDF files.
If current document was created from an existing document that uses object stream then this property will be automatically set to true.
If current document uses any PDF feature from PDF standard version 1.5 or later then this property will be automatically set to true.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSaveOptions.WriteEncrypted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether produced PDF file will be encrypted.
member.value: true if library will write PDF files encrypted; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This property is read-only and useful as indicator only. To make library write encrypted files please set or .
Value of this property is true if an user or an owner password was set for the document.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSaveOptions.Linearize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether output PDF files should be linearized for faster web viewing.
member.value: true if library should linearize output PDF files; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Linearization (sometimes called Fast Web View by Adobe) restructures a PDF document for page-at-a-time downloading (byte-serving) from web servers.

A linearized (or a Fast Web View optimized) PDF file is a file that has been organized in a special way to enable efficient incremental access in a network environment. The file is valid PDF in all respects, and is compatible with all existing viewers and other PDF applications. Enhanced viewer applications can recognize that a PDF file has been linearized and can take advantage of that organization (as well as added hint information) to enhance viewing performance. This is especially important with large documents that can take a long time to download from a server.

Please note that linearized document will display faster if you set property to and property to because it will minimize the amount of objects a PDF viewer should process before showing first page of the document.
Please note that fillable PDF forms won't usually benefit from being linearized.
Default value: false.
If current document was created from an existing linearized document then this property will be automatically set to true.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSaveOptions.MetadataSyncMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating how values in XMP Metadata and Document Info should be synchronized.
member.value: The value indicating how values in XMP Metadata and Document Info should be synchronized.

remarks.para: Default value: .

By default, library will synchronize XMP Metadata and Document Info using XMP metadata values from as source of the information. If any of the fields is null then library will use corresponding field of as source of the information.

For Author name, for example, library will try property first, then (if is null). After that all fields with similar purpose that are not null (like PdfDocument.Metadata.DublinCore.Creator or PdfDocument.Metadata.Core.Author) will be updated.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureAppearanceOptions
member.summary: The options for a PDF signature appearance.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfSignatureAppearanceOptions.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets the image to display inside of the signature.
member.value: The image to display inside of the signature.

remarks.para: Default value: null.

If the text of the signature is left justified, then the image will be placed on the left side of the signature. With a right-justified text, the image will be placed on the right side of the signature. In both cases, the image will occupy up to the half of the signature field width.
The image will be placed in the center of the signature if there is no text to display.

The image can be resized to fit into available width and/or height. The aspect ratio of the image is always preserved. The image vertical center is aligned with the vertical center of the available area.

member.summary: The text extraction options.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfTextExtractionOptions.WithFormatting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to extract text formatted as seen in a PDF viewer.
member.remarks: Default value: false.
member.value: true if extract text formatted as seen in a PDF viewer; false otherwise.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfTextExtractionOptions.SkipInvisibleText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to extract hidden text.
member.value: true to do not extract hidden text; false otherwise. Default value: false.

remarks.para: This property allows to skip text when:

ul.li: Text is rendered in the mode that produces no visible output (like PdfTextRenderingMode.).
Text is drawn outside of active clip region.
Text is drawn on a hidden layer.

remarks.para: Note that there are other ways to hide text in PDF document. For example, text can be overlapped by other page objects (e.g. by image, form control or filled rectangle). Or text can be drawn with the same color as background (e.g. white text on white background).

property does not allow to skip text in such cases. Extract and handle page objects manually to skip text hidden with such techniques. Look at "Pages and Navigation -> Extract text, paths and images" sample for more detail.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfTextExtractionOptions.Rectangle
member.summary: Gets or sets the rectangle of interest.
member.value: The rectangle to extract the text from or null if all the text should be extracted.

remarks.para: Default value: null.
If the value is null then all the text inside the page will be extracted.

If the value is not null AND the is true then only the text inside the specified rectangle will be extracted. Any part of a word which is outside of the rectangle will be truncated. Characters that are partially inside the rectangle (partially visible) will be extracted.
If the value is not null AND the is false then only the text that intersects the specified rectangle will be extracted. Any part of a word which is outside of the rectangle will be extracted too.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfBezierSegment
member.summary: Cubic Bezier curve segment.

remarks.para: Such curves are defined by four points: the two endpoints (the start point P0 and the final point P3 ) and two control points P1 and P2. Given the coordinates of the four points, the curve is generated by varying the parameter t from 0.0 to 1.0 in the following equation:
Cubic BГ©zier curves have two useful properties:

ul.li: The curve can be very quickly split into smaller pieces for rapid rendering.

The curve is contained within the convex hull of the four points defining the curve, most easily visualized as the polygon obtained by stretching a rubber band around the outside of the four points. This property allows rapid testing of whether the curve lies completely outside the visible region, and hence does not have to be rendered.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfClipRegion
member.summary: Class for a clip region that limits the parts of the page affected by painting operators.

remarks.para: The closed subpaths of this region define the area that can be painted. Marks falling inside this area are applied to the page; those falling outside it are not.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfClipRegion.IntersectedPaths
member.summary: Gets paths of this .

remarks.para: Clip region consist of a sequence of intersected paths. Use the following algorithm to calculate the final clipping area:

ol.li: Set the current clipping area to an infinite rectangle { -Infinity, -Infinity, Infinity, Infinity }.
Enumerate paths in the collection starting from first element. Order is important.
Intersect the current clipping area with each using the rule defined by property. Set the current clipping area to the result of the intersection.
When all are processed, the current clipping area defines which parts lie inside the clip region.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPath
member.summary: Class for a vector path retrieved from a PDF document page.

remarks.para: Paths define shapes, trajectories, and regions of all sorts. They are used to draw lines, define the shapes of filled areas, and specify boundaries for clipping other graphics. The graphics state includes a current clipping path that defines the clipping boundary for the current page. At the beginning of each page, the clipping path is initialized to include the entire page.

A path is made up of one or more disconnected subpaths, each comprising a sequence of connected segments. The topology of the path is unrestricted: it may be concave or convex, may contain multiple subpaths representing disjoint areas, and may intersect itself in arbitrary ways.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfPathSegment
member.summary: Segment of a vector path. A part of .
member.remarks: A path is composed of straight and curved line segments, which may connect to one another or may be disconnected. A pair of segments are said to connect only if they are defined consecutively, with the second segment starting where the first one ends. Thus, the order in which the segments of a path are defined is significant. Nonconsecutive segments that meet or intersect fortuitously are not considered to connect.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfCanvas.FlatnessTolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the flatness tolerance.
member.value: The flatness tolerance.
member.remarks:
The flatness tolerance controls the maximum permitted distance in pixels between the mathematically correct path and an approximation constructed from straight line segments.
Default value: 1.0.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current font for text-drawing operation.
member.remarks: Default value:
member.value: The font for text-drawing operation.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfCanvas.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the current font in points.
member.remarks: Default value: 8 points.
member.value: The size of the current font in points.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfCanvas.TextPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the current text position.
member.remarks: Consecutive text-drawing operations that do not explicitly specify start position will use this position as the start one.
member.value: The text position.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfCanvas.TextAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the text rotation angle in degrees.
member.remarks:
Text gets rotated in counter-clockwise direction.
Default value: 0 degrees (no rotation).
member.value: The text rotation angle, in degrees.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfCanvas.CharacterSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the current character spacing.
member.remarks:
The character spacing parameter is a number specified in unscaled text space units (although it is subject to scaling by the parameter if the writing mode is horizontal). When the glyph for each character in the string is rendered, character spacing is added to the horizontal or vertical component of the glyph's displacement, depending on the writing mode.
Default value: 0.
member.value: The character spacing.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfCanvas.WordSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the current word spacing.
member.remarks:
Word spacing works the same way as but applies only to the space character. The word spacing parameter is added to the glyph's horizontal or vertical displacement (depending on the writing mode). For horizontal writing, a positive value for word spacing has the effect of increasing the spacing between words.
Default value: 0.
member.value: The word spacing.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfCanvas.TextHorizontalScaling
member.summary: Gets or sets the current horizontal scaling of text.
member.remarks:
The horizontal scaling parameter adjusts the width of glyphs by stretching or compressing them in the horizontal direction. Its value is specified as a percentage of the normal width of the glyphs, with 100 being the normal width.
Default value: 100.
member.value: The horizontal scaling of text.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfCanvas.TextRenderingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the current text rendering mode.
member.remarks: Default value: .
member.value: The text rendering mode.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfCanvas.TextRise
member.summary: Gets or sets the current text rise.
member.remarks:
Text rise specifies the distance, in unscaled text space units, to move the baseline up or down from its default location. Positive values of text rise move the baseline up. Adjustments to the baseline are useful for drawing superscripts or subscripts. The default location of the baseline can be restored by setting the text rise to 0.
Default value: 0.
member.value: The text rise.

member.remarks: Default value:
member.value: The blend mode.

if you want to draw an arc immediately.

member.summary: Draws the specified text string in the specified rectangle using specified formatting options.
member.param: The string to draw.
The structure that specifies the location of the drawn text.
The horizontal alignment of the drawn text within the rectangle.
The vertical alignment of the drawn text within the rectangle.
member.remarks:
The text represented by the parameter may be drawn in multiple lines. This method clips the text so that it does not appear outside the specified rectangle. Lines are automatically broken between words if a word would extend past the edge of the rectangle specified by the parameter. A carriage return-line feed sequence also breaks the line.
Please use if you want to draw only one line of text.
member.overloads: Draws the specified text string in the specified rectangle using specified formatting options.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfCanvas.MoveInlineImagesToResources
member.summary: Moves all inline images to resources.

remarks.para: This method replaces each inline image with a regular one. This does not affect visual representation of the canvas.
Moving inline images to resources can increase file size because regular images do not use abbreviated image property names.
You might want to move inline images to resources if you are going to scale, resize, recompress the inline images or replace their contents.
Moving inline images to resources can decrease length of the collection of the owning page images. This is because the library de-duplicates images when moving them to resources.

member.overloads: Moves inline images to resources.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfCanvas.MoveInlineImagesToResources(System.Predicate{BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfImage})
member.summary: Moves some of the inline images to resources.
member.param: The delegate that defines the conditions of inline images that should be moved to resources.

remarks.para: This method replaces inline images that match the conditions of the delegate with regular ones. This does not affect visual representation of the canvas.
Moving inline images to resources can increase file size because regular images do not use abbreviated image property names.
You might want to move inline images to resources if you are going to scale, resize, recompress the inline images or replace their contents.
Moving inline images to resources can decrease length of the collection of the owning page images. This is because the library de-duplicates images when moving them to resources.

remarks.para: This property provides access to the basic PDF document metadata properties defined by PDF standard.
Please use property to access larger set of metadata properties defined by XMP standard. You may also add custom metadata properties using property.
This interface defines the same properties as the class.

By default, the library will synchronize values setup through this and properties before saving document. Please take a look at property for more information about how the library will synchronize the values.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDocument.Metadata
member.summary: Gets the XMP metadata attached to the document.
member.value: The XMP metadata attached to the document.

remarks.para: This property provides access to metadata properties defined by XMP standard.
Please use property to access basic PDF document properties defined by PDF standard.
Please note that setting any of the XMP metadata properties will cause document to be saved using at least version 1.4 of the PDF standard.

By default, the library will synchronize values setup through this and properties before saving document. Please take a look at property for more information about how the library will synchronize the values.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDocument.IsLinearized
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this document is linearized (optimized for fast viewing on the web).
member.value: true if this document is linearized (optimized for fast viewing on the web); otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This value is read-only and useful as indicator only. Please use property (available via property) if you want to produce linearized PDF files with Docotic.Pdf.
Linearization (sometimes called Fast Web View by Adobe) restructures a PDF document for page-at-a-time downloading (byte-serving) from web servers.

A linearized (or a Fast Web View optimized) PDF file is a file that has been organized in a special way to enable efficient incremental access in a network environment. The file is valid PDF in all respects, and is compatible with all existing viewers and other PDF applications. Enhanced viewer applications can recognize that a PDF file has been linearized and can take advantage of that organization (as well as added hint information) to enhance viewing performance. This is especially important with large documents that can take a long time to download from a server.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDocument.OwnerPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets the owner password for the document.
member.value: The owner password for the document.
member.remarks:
Opening the document with the correct owner password (assuming it is not the same as the ) allows full (owner) access to the document. This unlimited access includes the ability to change the document's passwords and access permissions.
Setting or property to a non-empty string causes the document to be saved encrypted.
Setting and property to the empty string causes the document to be saved unencrypted.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDocument.UserPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets the user password for the document.
member.value: The user password for the document.
member.remarks:
Opening the document with the correct user password (or opening the document that does not have a user password) allows additional operations to be performed according to the user access .
Setting or property to a non-empty string causes the document to be saved encrypted.
Setting and property to the empty string causes the document to be saved unencrypted.
If the password is set and the is not then document will be saved with the same value for the user and owner password.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDocument.Encryption
member.summary: Gets or sets encryption algorithm for the current document.
member.value: The encryption algorithm for the current document.

remarks.para: After opening an existing document this property returns the encryption algorithm that was used when the document was created.
Setting this property selects the encryption algorithm to use when saving the document.
Document will be encrypted only if at least one of the and properties is set to a non-empty string.

To enable password dialog on document opening, the property must be set to a non-empty string. Setting a non-empty string to the property only will cause document to be encrypted but no password will be needed to open the document.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDocument.DocumentsAreEqual(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compares the data and structure of two PDF documents.
member.param: The first PDF document to compare.
The second PDF document to compare.
The password that unlocks PDF file with applied password security.
member.returns: true if documents are equal; otherwise false
member.remarks:
This method is useful for regression tests when you compare two versions of the same document.
Password specified by the parameter is used for both files (it's assumed that both files have the same password set or both files have no password set). Please use empty string for parameter if files being compared are not protected with password.
Differences in CreationDate and ModifiedDate properties, document metadata and file trailer IDs of document being compared do not get taken into account.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDocument.ReplaceDuplicateObjects
member.summary: Replaces duplicate document objects with the first duplicate.

remarks.para: This method finds all groups of object duplicates and replaces all objects from each group of duplicates with the first item of the group.
This method replaces duplicates of all supported kinds. The kinds are mentioned in .
This method gives good results for documents which were incrementally updated or created by a merge of several documents with the same objects.
To actually reduce output file size, this method requires removal of unused objects afterwards. Because of this, SaveOptions. property will be set to true automatically when using this method.

To be able to replace duplicate inline images too, use one of the
methods before calling any of the methods.

member.overloads: Replaces duplicate document objects with the first duplicate.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDocument.ReplaceDuplicateObjects(BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDuplicateObjectKinds)
member.summary: Replaces duplicate document objects with the first duplicate.
member.param: Kinds of objects that should be replaced

remarks.para: This method checks objects of the specified kinds. For each specified kind it finds all groups of object duplicates. Then the method replaces all objects from each group of duplicates with the first item of the group.
This method gives good results for documents which were incrementally updated or created by a merge of several documents with the same objects.
To actually reduce output file size, this method requires removal of unused objects afterwards. Because of this, SaveOptions. property will be set to true automatically when using this method.

To be able to replace duplicate inline images too, use one of the
methods before calling any of the methods.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfDocument.FlattenControls
member.summary: Flattens all controls in the document. In effect, replaces controls with their appearance. Putting it differently, merges controls down on to their respective pages.

remarks.para: Flattening locks controls from editing. Flattening can significantly reduce file size if property is set to true.

This method enumerates all controls in the document and flattens every control in 2 steps:
Draws control on its parent page using text and vector graphics operators.
Removes control from the PdfPage. collection of its parent page.
This method can change graphics state of the page. To avoid possible side effects, call the method right before saving of the document.
Flattening of signature fields without appearance stream is not supported yet.

If this view is used in a then the target page can be specified by either this property or property. In any case the specified page it located in the current document.

The coordinate is relative to the bottom edge of the page. I.e. offset 0 means "display bottom edge of the at the top edge of the window", which effectively means "display the top edge of the next page at the top edge of the window".

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfEmbeddedFile
member.summary: Class for a file embedded in PDF.

remarks.para: File specifications (see ) ordinarily refer to files external to the PDF file in which they occur. When a PDF file is archived or transmitted, all external files it refers to must accompany it to preserve the fileвЂ™s integrity.

Embedded files address this problem by allowing the contents of referenced files to be embedded directly within the body of the PDF file. This makes the PDF file a self-contained unit that can be stored or transmitted as a single entity.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfEmbeddedFile.Id
member.summary: Gets the identifier of this embedded file in this .
member.value: The identifier of this embedded file in this .

remarks.para: The identifier has the following properties:

list.item: Different embedded files from the same object will have different identifiers.
Same embedded files from multiple objects will have same identifiers. Two embedded files are said to be the same when they are based on internal PDF structures with the same number.
Embedded files from different documents have same identifiers if those embedded files are based on internal PDF structures with the same number.
Any change to a object which does not renumber its internal structures does not change the identifier.
When library saves a document it might renumber its internal structures. Therefore, the identifier might change after invocation of any of the methods.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfEmbeddedFile.Size
member.summary: Gets the size of the embedded file, in bytes.
member.value: The size of the embedded file, in bytes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the MIME media type of the embedded file.
member.value: The MIME media type of the embedded file or null if there is no value set for this property.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfEmbeddedFile.CreationDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time when the embedded file was created.
member.value: The date and time when the embedded file was created or null if there is no value set for this property.
member.remarks: Returned date and time (what you get) expressed in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). Provided date and time (what you set) is expected to be in local time zone.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfEmbeddedFile.ModifiedDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time when the embedded file was last modified.
member.value: The date and time when the embedded file was last modified or null if there is no value set for this property.
member.remarks: Returned date and time (what you get) expressed in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). Provided date and time (what you set) is expected to be in local time zone.

member.value: The value indicating whether this file should be embedded as is, without being compressed.

member.returns: The MD5 checksum of the embedded file or null if checksum is not specified in PDF.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfFileSpecification
member.summary: Class for a file specification.

remarks.para: A PDF file can refer to the contents of another file by using a file specification.

The file designated by a file specification is normally external to the PDF file referring to it. But it's also possible to embed external file within the referring PDF file, allowing its contents to be stored or transmitted along with the PDF file. See class.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfFileSpecification.Specification
member.summary: Gets the file specification string.

remarks.para: The string is divided into component substrings separated by the slash character (/).
A simple file specification that begins with a slash is an absolute file specification. The last component is the file name; the preceding components specify its context.
A file specification that does not begin with a slash is a relative file specification giving the location of the file relative to that of the PDF file containing it.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfFileSpecification.Description
member.summary: Gets the description of the file specification.
member.value: The description of the file specification or null if description is not present.

member.summary: Gets the embedded file associated with the file specification.
member.value: The embedded file associated with the file specification or null if embedded file is not present.

member.summary: Adds custom key-name pair to this file specification.
member.param: The key part of the pair.
The value (name) part of the pair.

remarks.para: This method throws if is one of the keys defined in PDF Reference for File Specification Dictionaries.
The must not be null.
Providing null for the removes existing value for the specified (if any).
The pair will be stored as /key /name in this file specification dictionary.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfFont.TopSideBearing
member.summary: Gets the vertical distance from the baseline to the top of the font bounding box, expressed in the glyph coordinate system.

value.para: The vertical distance from the baseline to the top of the font bounding box. Usually, this is a positive value.
Font bounding box is the smallest rectangle enclosing the shape that would result if all of the glyphs of the font were placed with their origins coincident and then filled.

remarks.para: See for more detail about relation between glyph and canvas coordinate systems.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfFont.TransformationMatrix
member.summary: Gets the transformation matrix used to map coordinates from this font's glyph coordinate system to canvas coordinate system.
member.value: The transformation used to map coordinates from the glyph space to canvas space.

remarks.para: The glyph coordinate system is the space in which an individual character's glyph is defined. The glyph origin is the point (0, 0) in the glyph coordinate system. Y axis is directed from the bottom to the top.
For all font types except Type 3, the units of glyph space are one-thousandth of a unit of a canvas space. The is equal to { 0.001, 0, 0, 0.001, 0, 0 } for all fonts except Type 3.
For a Type 3 font, the can have an arbitrary value.
The canvas coordinate system is the coordinate system of a . It is used when text is drawn on a , on a or on a .

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfFont.Unembed
member.summary: Removes font bytes from the PDF file.
member.returns: true if font bytes were successfully removed; otherwise, false.

remarks.para:
This method might fail to remove font bytes in the following cases:
Font is not embedded. For such fonts the property is false.
Font is used by one of form controls (, , etc.) and therefore can't be unembedded. A PDF reader might be unable to view or change text in a control if the control uses an unembedded font.
Font is a Type3 font. Type3 fonts cannot be unembedded by its nature.
Current document will be saved as a PDF/A document. For such documents PdfDocument.SaveOptions. property is true. PDF/A documents should have all used fonts embedded.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfFont.Embed
member.summary: Tries to embed font bytes into the PDF file.
member.returns: true if font bytes were successfully found and embedded; otherwise, false.

remarks.para:
This method might fail to embed font bytes in the following cases:
Font is already embedded. For such fonts the property is true.
Font bytes were not found in the collection of fonts installed in the operating system and in the collection of built-in PDF fonts.
Font is not allowed to be embedded in documents (according to the license associated with the font).
Font is a Type3 font. Type3 fonts are always embedded by its nature.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfFont.RemoveUnusedGlyphs
member.summary: Removes unused glyphs from the font.
member.returns: true if unused glyphs were successfully removed from the font; otherwise, false

remarks.para:
This method might fail to remove unused glyphs in the following cases:
Font is not embedded. For such fonts the property is false.
Font is used in a or and therefore all font glyphs should be preserved. A PDF reader or editor might be unable to change text in a control if some glyphs are missed in the font.
Font is of an unsupported type. For now, only TrueType fonts, created with method are supported.
This method is useful for decreasing size of produced PDF documents. The method creates a font subset with used glyphs only and embeds the subset in the current document.
A glyph is treated as used if current document contains character drawn with the glyph.
This method does not remove unused glyphs from Type1 fonts and from any fonts in existing PDF documents.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfFont.ContainsGlyphsForText(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether this font contains all glyphs required to draw the given text.
member.param: Text to check.
member.returns: true if this font contains all glyphs required to draw the . Otherwise, false.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfFont.FixEncoding
member.summary: Fixes PDF font encoding if possible.
member.returns: true if font encoding was updated; otherwise, false

remarks.para: Some PDF generators produce PDF documents with broken font encodings. Extraction of text from such documents is not possible.
This method tries to fix font encoding in the PDF document. It reads information about encoding in the font bytes and updates PDF encoding correspondingly.
This method might fail if font bytes do not contain information about encoding. This method does not support certain PDF font types (e.g. ).

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfImage.Id
member.summary: Gets the identifier of this image in this .
member.value: The identifier of the image in this .

remarks.para: The identifier has the following properties:

list.item: For all inline images the identifier is equal to null.
Different non-inline images from the same object have different identifiers. None of these identifiers is equal to null.
Same images from multiple objects have same identifiers. Two images are said to be the same when they are based on internal PDF structures with the same number.
Images from different documents have same identifiers if those images are based on internal PDF structures with the same number.
Any change to a object which does not renumber its internal structures does not change the identifier.
When library saves a document it might renumber its internal structures. Therefore, the identifier might change after invocation of any of the methods.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfImage.Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets the mask image for this .
member.value: The mask image for this .

remarks.para: The returned value can be a stencil mask, or a soft mask, or null if there is no mask image associated with the image. If the property is true for the returned image then the mask is a stencil one. Otherwise, the mask is a soft mask.

This property can be used to set stencil or soft mask for the image. If the provided value is an image with its property equal to true then the value is treated as a stencil mask. Otherwise, the value is treated as a soft mask.

For any provided value, which is not a grayscale image (1 color channel, 8 bits per channel, gray color space) and not a stencil mask, the following is performed: the image gets converted to RGB, the R (red) component of the converted image is then used as a soft mask image.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfImage.HasMask
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this has associated mask color, a stencil mask image or a soft mask.
member.value: true if this has associated mask color, a stencil mask image or a soft mask. false if this has no associated mask.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfImage.IsMask
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is a stencil mask image.
member.value: true if this is a stencil mask image; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: An image mask is a monochrome image in which each sample is specified by a single bit. However, instead of being painted in opaque black and white, the image mask is treated as a stencil mask that is partly opaque and partly transparent.

Sample values in the image do not represent black and white pixels; rather, they designate places on the page that should either be marked with the current color or masked out (not marked at all). Areas that are masked out retain their former contents. The effect is like applying paint in the current color through a cut-out stencil, which lets the paint reach the page in some places and masks it out in others.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfImage.UseMaskInverted
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the bits of the mask image of this should be inverted.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfImage.InterpolateWhenDrawn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an image interpolation algorithm should be applied during rendering of this image.
member.value: true if an image interpolation algorithm should be applied during rendering of this image.; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfImage.IsInline
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is an inline image.
member.value: true if this is an inline image; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Inline images are completely contained inside the contents of their owner pages. Such images typically has small width and height. One inline images can not be used on more than one page.
Regular images are stored independently of any page contents. Pages that use a regular image contain a reference to the image. Any number of pages can reference the same regular image.
Inline images can not be recompressed and you can not replace their contents unless you move them to resources using .

member.overloads: Saves the image to a file or a stream.

remarks.para: Mask images (see property) are always saved according to usual PDF convention:

item.description: White pixels corresponds to masked-out area, the "transparent" pixels. Such masked out area will not be painted on the page.

Black pixels corresponds to unmasked area, the "opaque" pixels. Such unmasked area will be painted on the page with the current fill color or corresponding portion of the base image (when this mask image is set as for other image).

member.name: M:BitMiracle.Docotic.Pdf.PdfImage.Uncompress
member.summary: Uncompresses image data.

remarks.para: Calling this method will cause image data to be saved without any compression.
Saving image data without compression will cause output PDF file to be bigger in size, so this method probably should be used only if required for compatibility reasons.
This method throws when used on an inline image. You can check property before invoking this method.

member.summary: Recompresses image data using zlib/deflate compression method.

remarks.para: Image data is recompressed using maximum (9) compression quality.
This method throws when used on an inline image. You can check property before invoking this method.

member.overloads: Recompresses image data using zlib/deflate compression method.
